info.title: Josplay Music Data API
info.description:
Josplay Music Data API is a comprehensive music information platform that provides up-to-date and accurate data on various aspects of the music industry.

This API is designed to help developers easily integrate music information into their applications, allowing them to access a vast library of music data, including Artists, Bands, Releases, Tracks, and more. 

With its flexible and user-friendly interface, developers can easily retrieve and manipulate data to fit their specific needs, making it a perfect choice for music-based applications and projects. 

Whether you're building a music streaming service, a music trivia app, or a platform for music lovers, Josplay Music Data API is the ideal tool to help you achieve your goals.

The Josplay Music Data API was built with developers in mind, prioritizing easy integration and peace of mind for other developers looking to access and use music data in their own applications. With a focus on robust and well-documented endpoints, developers can easily access and utilize music data to enhance their own projects.

parameters.name: personId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the target Person.

get.summary: GET details of the Person with the provided ID
get.description: A GET operation is an HTTP request method used to retrieve data from a server. In the context of the Person model, a GET operation to retrieve a Person object would allow the client to retrieve information about a particular person in the music industry. This information may include the person's name, their role in the industry (e.g. artist, songwriter, composer, producer), their discography, and other relevant information. The response from the server would be a representation of the Person object in the requested format, such as JSON.

parameters.name: personId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the target Person.

get.summary: GET all discography of the Person (Artist) with the provided ID
get.description: A GET operation that returns a Person's discography retrieves a list of musical releases (such as albums, singles, compilations, etc.) associated with a specific Person in the music industry. This operation takes in the identifier of the Person (such as their UUID) and returns a list of all the musical releases that they have contributed to as an artist, songwriter, composer, producer, or any other relevant role. The response includes details such as the release title, main artist, genre, release date, and any other relevant information about each release. This operation is useful for retrieving a comprehensive overview of a Person's body of work in the music industry.

get.summary: GET all Participations of a Person
get.description: The endpoint that returns all the Participations of a Person in the music industry is a GET operation that retrieves information about a person's involvement in the creation of musical works. It lists the roles that the person played in the making of a song, excluding the role of Main Artist. This information can be used to understand the person's contributions to the music industry and their impact on the creative process of creating songs.

get.summary: GET editorial details of a Release
get.description: The endpoint is a GET operation that accepts a release ID as a parameter. When a valid release ID is provided, the endpoint returns a complete Release object, including its UUID, title, main artist, audience, description, number of tracks, release country, label, participants, release type, publisher, genres, edit state, release date, and cover art. The returned object provides all the relevant information about a particular release, allowing the caller to understand its contents, production details, and other important aspects. If the provided release ID does not match any existing releases, the endpoint returns an error response indicating that the requested release could not be found.

get.summary: Get editorial details of a Track
get.description: The GET endpoint returns detailed information about a specific Track. The trackId is a required parameter in the request and is used to identify the track. Acceptable `trackId` are: `ISRC`, `JosplayId` or `UUID`. Track UUID's are provided by Josplay. The response will include information such as the track title, main artist, track length, album, and other relevant details. This endpoint allows clients to retrieve information about a specific track and use it in their application or service.

get.summary: GET details of the Artist with the provided ID
get.description: A GET operation is an HTTP request method used to retrieve data from a server. In the context of the Artist model, a GET operation to retrieve a Artist object would allow the client to retrieve information about a particular person in the music industry. This information may include the artist's name, their role in the industry is fixed to Artist, their discography, and other relevant information. The response from the server would be a representation of the Artist object in the requested format, such as JSON.

get.summary: GET all discography of the Artist with the provided ID
get.description: A GET operation that returns an Artist's discography retrieves a list of musical releases (such as albums, singles, compilations, etc.) associated with a specific Artist in the music industry. This operation takes in the identifier of the Person (such as their UUID) and returns a list of all the musical releases that they have contributed to as an artist. The response includes details such as the release title, main artist, genre, release date, and any other relevant information about each release. This operation is useful for retrieving a comprehensive overview of an Artist's body of work in the music industry and similar to the Person operation equivalent.

get.summary: GET all Participation of an Artist
get.description: The endpoint that returns all the Participations of an Artist where their role is not an Artists. It lists the roles that the Artist played in the making of a song, excluding the role of Main Artist. This information can be used to understand the person's contributions to the music industry and their impact on the creative process of creating songs.

The GET request for the endpoint that returns an array of Photos for an Artist is used to retrieve all the photos associated with a specific Person, given the Person's id as a required parameter. This request returns a list of Photo objects, each of which contains details such as the title, description, source, photographer, and other relevant information related to the image. The response is filtered based on the personId, ensuring that only photos associated with the requested Person are returned.

The GET endpoint that returns full details of a Band is an API endpoint that allows users to retrieve the complete information of a Band, given its unique bandId as the parameter. The bandId is a required field and must be passed as a query parameter to the API endpoint.

The API response would contain all the details of the Band, such as the UUID, name, members, genres, and other relevant information. The response will be in JSON format and will be limited to the details that are publicly available. The API endpoint may also include error responses in case the bandId is not found or if there are any other issues with the API request.

get.summary: GET all discography of the Band with the provided ID
get.description: A GET operation that returns a Person's discography retrieves a list of musical releases (such as albums, singles, compilations, etc.) associated with a specific Band. This operation takes in the identifier of the Band (such as their UUID, ISNI, BOWI) and returns a list of all the musical releases that they have contributed to as an artist. The response includes details such as the release title, mainArtist - which will equal this Band's UUID, genre, release date, and any other relevant information about each release. This operation is useful for retrieving a comprehensive overview of a Band's body of work.

The GET request for the endpoint that returns an array of Photos for a Person is used to retrieve all the photos associated with a specific Person, given the Person's id as a required parameter. This request returns a list of Photo objects, each of which contains details such as the title, description, source, photographer, and other relevant information related to the image. The response is filtered based on the personId, ensuring that only photos associated with the requested Person are returned.

The GET request for the endpoint that returns an array of Photos for a Person is used to retrieve all the photos associated with a specific Person, given the Person's id as a required parameter. This request returns a list of Photo objects, each of which contains details such as the title, description, source, photographer, and other relevant information related to the image. The response is filtered based on the personId, ensuring that only photos associated with the requested Person are returned.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: A string to search. Result will include items that most closely match the result

get.summary: Universal Search on Person, Artist, Band
get.description:
This is a GET request that returns a collection of Person, Artist, and Band entities, based on a search query. The search is performed by matching the search query string against relevant fields such as name, description, and other attributes.

The request accepts three query parameters:

`query`: The string to be searched for.

`limit`: The maximum number of results to be returned in a single request.

`offset`: The starting point of the results to be returned. This is useful for pagination.

The response of the request is an array of objects representing the Person, Artist, and Band entities that match the search query, limited by the `limit` parameter, and starting from the `offset` position. The result is ranked by Artist, Band, and Person

400.description: Bad Request. The request was invalid or cannot be served.

401.description: Unauthorized. The request requires user authentication or, if the request included authorization credentials, authorization has been refused for those credentials.

403.description: Forbidden. The server understood the request, but it refuses to authorize it.

404.description: Not Found. The requested resource could not be found but may be available again in the future.

500.description: Internal Server Error. An internal server error occurred while processing the request.

UUID.description: A unique identifier for the artist

title.description: The artist's title, which is a combination of the artist''s first and last name

dateOfBirth.description: The date of birth of the artist

dateOfDeath.description: The date of death of the artist

stageName.description: The stage name of the artist

country.description: The country the artist is from

type.description: This value will always be Artist, for an Artist

otherLanguages.description: Other languages spoken by the artist

self.description: The link to the artist's profile

biography.description: The link to the artist's biography

images.description: The link to the artist's images

discography.description: The link to the artist's discography

Person.description: A Person in the music industry refers to an individual who is involved in creating and producing music. This can include artists, who perform and interpret songs, songwriters, who write the lyrics and music for songs, composers, who create original pieces of music, producers, who oversee the recording and production of music, and many other roles. A Person can also be a combination of these roles, and the specific role they play in the creation of music can vary depending on the project they are working on.

mainArtist.description: Main artist associated with the release

numTracks.description: Number of tracks in the release

label.description: Record label associated with the release

participants.description: List of participants involved in the release

releaseType.description: Type of release (e.g. album, single, etc.)

genres.description: List of genres associated with the release

editState.description: Current state of the release (e.g. draft, published, etc.)

coverArt.description: URL to the cover art for the release

Release.description: A Release is a collection of tracks that are meant to be sold or made available to the public. A Release can take various forms such as an Album, Single, Compilation, or Extended Play (EP). The Release is usually associated with an artist or a group of artists and is characterized by a title, main artist, audience, description, number of tracks, release country, label, participants, release type, publisher, genres, edit state, release date, and cover art.

featuredArtist.description: List of featured artists on the track

releaseId.description: Identifier of the Release the track belongs to

participants.description: List of participants and contributors on the track that are not lead performers

genres.description: List of genres the track percievable in the track

identifiers.description: List of external identifers for the track. E.g. ISRC, BOWI, JosplayId

duration.description: Duration of the track in seconds

artist.description: Link to the main artist of this track

release.description: Link to the release this track belongs to

participants.description: Link to the participants of this track

analysis.description: Link to the ai audio analysis of this track

Track.description: A Track, also known as a song, is a recorded composition that forms a part of a larger musical release such as an album or EP. It typically features vocals, instrumentals, and lyrics. Tracks can vary in length, genre, and style and can be created by artists, songwriters, composers, and producers. They are typically recorded in a studio and can be made available for streaming or purchase.

UUID.description: A unique identifier for the band

description.description: A short description of the band

pid.description: The unique identifier of the member

roles.description: The roles of the member in the band

status.description: The status of the member in the band

dateOfFormation.description: Date of formation of the band - precision is on the year of formation.

self.description: The link to the band's profile

biography.description: The link to the band's biography

images.description: The link to the band's images

discography.description: The link to the band's discography

type.description: This value will always be Artist, for an Artist

Artist.description: An Artist is an individual or group who creates and performs music. This can include singers, musicians, bands, and other performers in the music industry. They may also be involved in other aspects of music creation, such as songwriting, composing, producing, and more. An Artist is often recognized for their unique sound and style, and they may release albums and perform live shows to share their music with the world.

Discography.title: Discography
Discography.description: A discography refers to the complete collection of recorded works released by an artist. It encompasses all albums, singles, EPs, and other music releases that the artist has put out over the course of their career. The discography serves as a comprehensive overview of an artist's musical output and provides a timeline of their creative journey. It is a valuable resource for fans, music critics, and industry professionals, providing a rich source of information about the artist and their music.

UUID.description: A unique identifier for the participation.

pid.description: A string value representing the project ID, for example, the track UUID for the type 'track'. It is a required field.

type.description: A string value that defines the type of project the participation belongs to. It can be either 'track', 'release', 'book', 'film', or 'talk'. It is an enumerated field and is required.

party.description: A string value that represents the unique identifier (UUID) of the participant. It is a required field.

items.description: An array of string values that defines the roles played by the participant in the project.

Participation.description: A Participation model represents a contribution made by an individual or a group of individuals in a particular project such as a track, release, book, film, or talk.

UUID.description: A universally unique identifier for this photo

description.description: Description of the photo. This can be helpful for search and display.

source.description: The source where the photo was obtained

photographer.description: The photographer who took the photo. Default to Not Recorded when unavaible

tags.description: List of tags associated with the photo. Useful for search

pid.description: Person or Party or Project ID associated with the photo

API Key - 1.name: apikey
API Key - 1.description: An API key obtained through application registration

personId.name: personId
personId.description:
A `string` identifier for Person - includes Artists, Songwriters, Compossers, etc.
Acce[table ids are: `UUID` provided by Josplay, or an ISNI, IPI, a JosplayId, or a `stageName` (case sensistive). 
The use of `stageName` as an id for this request is discouraged. When `stageName` is used,
ensure the character case is exactly as used by the `Person`.

bandId.name: bandId
bandId.description:
'A `string` identifier for a Band. It can be a `UUID` provided by Josplay, or an ISNI, or a JosplayId'
A case sensitive `title` of the track may also be used.

trackId.name: trackId
trackId.description: Acceptable `trackId` are: `ISRC`, `JosplayId` or `UUID`. Track UUIDs are provided by Josplay.'''

releaseId.name: releaseId
releaseId.description:
'A `string` identifier for a Release.
Acceptable ids include `UUID` - provided by Josplay - or an ISWC, UPC (12-digits), or a JosplayId'.
A case sensitive string title of the Release can be used but discouraged.
